Detailed Description

Data set of character samples encoded as feature vectors.

This class stores a set of feature vectors that represents different characters. Every feature vector belongs to a category, i.e. a character. You can read a bunch of data, work with it and update it (adding new samples o deleting any of them).

Author:
Eliezer TalÃ³n (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-11-10

Member Typedef Documentation

DataSet::Sample

Sample of a data set.

This pair keeps the feature vector and the category that defines every sample in a data set.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataSet::DataSet ( const std::string &  sourceFile  ) 

Constructor.

Parameters:
sourceFile Path in the filesystem to the file containing the data set.
Precondition:
The source file must contain at least the number of features in its first line.
Postcondition:
The content in the file is loaded into samples_.

nFeatures_ is set to the number of features per sample.

size_ is set to the number of samples read.

Author:
Eliezer TalÃ³n (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-11-13
This constructor is intended to read a data set from a file. The source file where the data set is read from must have the following format:

The first line defines the number of features in every sample of the data set.

The following lines are the samples, with one sample per line. Every line has a number of fields up to the number of features defined in the first line plus one. Each field is separated by a whitespace. The last field represents the category of the sample. An example of a valid data set may be:

4

0.1 0.3 1.3 2.4 3

1.5 2.8 6.2 2.4 1

3.3 1.2 0.9 1.1 3

. . .

The fields representing the features must have a floating point format: both the integer and decimal parts are required and separated by a decimal point (not a comma). The field representing the category of the sample must be an integer.

Here is the call graph for this function:

DataSet::DataSet ( const std::string &  sourceFile,
const unsigned int &  nFeatures 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
sourceFile File path in the filesystem where the data set will be stored.
nFeatures Number of features of the data set
Postcondition:
An empty data set is created, with size_ set to zero and nFeatures_ set to the number passed.
Author:
Eliezer TalÃ³n (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-11-10
This constructor is intended to create an empty data set where only new samples will be added and previous samples in the source file, if any, are automatically discarded. Thus, the previous content will be cleared and updated to the new samples added.

DataSet::~DataSet (  ) 

Destructor.

Postcondition:
The changes made to the data set are written to disk. The output file is truncated and rewritten
